Former governor of Lagos State in the ill-fated Third Republic, Sir Michael Otedola, said he is quitting partisan politics for good. Former governor of Lagos State in the ill-fated Third Republic, Sir Michael Otedola, said he is quitting partisan politics for good.

Sir Otedola, whose government was regarded as slow to action and unexciting, told PMNews during the Obanta Day festival at ljebu-Ode that his experience in politics has taught him that politicians have not learnt their lessons. I have decided to call it quit with politics. FG Rolls Out 11 Secret Laws... The federal government of General Sani Abacha has secretly rolled out 11 laws. The enactment of the laws which has not been made public Says Shonekan was revealed this morning by Chief Gani Fawehinmi in a press release titled "PressAlert On Recent Obnox- lous Decrees." Most contentious of the new laws signed by Abacha are the Interim Gov- ernment (Validation, etc.) Decree No. 23, 1994 and the Legal Practitioners (Amendment) Decree No 21, 1994. The federal government of General Sani Abacha has secretly rolled out 11 laws. The enactment of the laws which has not been made public was revealed this morning by Chief Gand Fawehinml in a press release titled "PressAlert On RecentObnox- lous Decrees." The federal government of General Sani Abacha has secretly rolled out 11 laws. The enactment of the laws which has not been made public was revealed this morning by Chief Gand Fawehinml in a press release titled "PressAlert On RecentObnox- lous Decrees."

Most contentious of the new laws signed by Abacha are the Interim Gov- ernment (Validation, etc.) Decree No. 23, 1994 and the Legal Practitioners (Amendment) Decree No 21, 1994. The first according to Fawehinmi seeks desperately to validate Chief Ernest Shonekan's interim government which was booted out in Nov ember last year. Most contentious of the new laws signed by Abacha are the Interim Gov- ernment (Validation, etc.) Decree No. 23, 1994 and the Legal Practitioners (Amendment) Decree No 21, 1994. The first according to Fawehinmi seeks desperately to validate Chief Ernest Shonekan's interim government which was booted out in Nov ember last year.

Film Makers Scramble For Mandela's Book Film Makers Scramble For Mandela's Book

Mandela's Testimony Nelson Mandela holds up a copy of his autobiography, hunching party in Johannesburg yesterday. He wrote while imprisoned on Robben Island. AFP PHOTO. Mandela's Testimony Nelson Mandela holds up a copy of his autobiography, hunching party in Johannesburg yesterday. He wrote while imprisoned on Robben Island. AFP PHOTO.

President Nelson Mandela said yesterday he is negotiating the film rights to his runaway success autobiography which is expected to be sold out within hours of its South African release today. President Nelson Mandela said yesterday he is negotiating the film rights to his runaway success autobiography which is expected to be sold out within hours of its South African release today.

Mandela told a press conference that he is also planning a sequel to the autobiography, "Long Walk to Freedom" which, just two weeks after Its launch in Britain, has already moved into number six spot on the bestseller's list. Peter Matthews, managing director of South African publisher Macdonald Purnell, told the press conference that 40,000 hardcover of the book will go on sale in Johannesburg today.
